MLFM Adaptive Gradient Matching¶

class pydygp.linlatentforcemodels.MLFM_MH_AdapGrad(structure_matrices)[source]¶

This class does something related to this equation

(1)¶\[p(x) = ?\]

default initalisation requires only the specification of the structure matrices \(\mathbf{A}_{r}\) which make up the evolution equation

\[\dot{x}(t) = \left( A_0 + \sum_{r=1}^{R} g_r(t) A_r \right) x(t)\]

Read more in the User guide.

Model Parameters Setup

phi_setup(phi_priors=None, phi_proposals=None)[source]¶

Allows the option to specify a prior and proposal distribution for the hyper-parameters, \(\mathbf{\phi}_k\) for each of the \(K\) Gaussian processes modelling the latent trajectories.

phi_priors : list, optional

A list of the prior distribution objects for the collection of model parameters \(\boldsymbol{\phi}_k\) parameterising the pydygp.kernels.GradientKernel objects governing the prior covariance of the latent trajectories. Each list element has methods:

logpdf : callable
Returns the logpdf of the parameter \(\mathbf{\phi}_k\) under the prior distribution.
rvs : callable, optional
Returns a random sample of \(\mathbf{\phi}_k\) from the prior distribution.
phi_proposals : list, optional

A list of the proposal distribution objects for the collection of model parameters \(\boldsymbol{\psi}_k\) parameterising the pydygp.kernels.Kernel of the latent forces. Each list element has methods:

rvs : callable
Returns a tuple (xnew, q_ration) where xnew is a
psi_setup(psi_priors=None, psi_proposals=None)[source]¶

Allows the option to specify a prior and proposal distribution for the hyper-parameters, \(\mathbf{\psi}_k\) for each of the \(R\) latent Gaussian forces

x_gp_setup(kern_type='sqexp', x_kernels=None)[source]¶

Handles the initalisation of the latent Gaussian Processes. This involves constructing the GradientKernel

Note

While this initalises a list of GradientGaussianProcess objects they are essentially just containers for the GradientKernel because of the additional \(\gamma\) parameters. Once the Kernel is updated to include a ‘nugget’ variable this will be updated.

g_gp_setup(kern_type='sqexp', g_kernels=None)[source]¶

Model Initalisation

psi_init(method=None)[source]¶
g_gp_init(method='prior_rv', **kwargs)[source]¶
method : string (default is prior_rv)
One of ‘prior_rv’, ‘val’

Initalisation of the latent forces.

Note

Under the default simulation strategy the latent force ‘g’ are updated first so that it is not necessary to call this method before fitting

Model Fitting

dim = None¶

Initalise the container for mhparameters

g_gibbs_update()[source]¶

updates the latent force variables using gibbs sampling from the Gaussian posterior

g_gp_init(method='prior_rv', **kwargs)[source]
method : string (default is prior_rv)
One of ‘prior_rv’, ‘val’

Initalisation of the latent forces.

Note

Under the default simulation strategy the latent force ‘g’ are updated first so that it is not necessary to call this method before fitting

g_inv_scale_update()[source]¶

The variables \(\psi_{r0}\) is given a conjugate gamma prior

init_latent_vars(x0s=None, g0s='prior', x_gps_kpar='None', g_gps_kpar='None')[source]¶

Initalises the latent variables in a way that respects the model hierarchy

mh_pars = None¶

various flags for model customisation

phi_setup(phi_priors=None, phi_proposals=None)[source]

Allows the option to specify a prior and proposal distribution for the hyper-parameters, \(\mathbf{\phi}_k\) for each of the \(K\) Gaussian processes modelling the latent trajectories.

A list of the prior distribution objects for the collection of model parameters \(\boldsymbol{\phi}_k\) parameterising the pydygp.kernels.GradientKernel objects governing the prior covariance of the latent trajectories. Each list element has methods:

logpdf : callable
Returns the logpdf of the parameter \(\mathbf{\phi}_k\) under the prior distribution.

Returns a random sample of \(\mathbf{\phi}_k\) from the prior distribution.

psi_setup(psi_priors=None, psi_proposals=None)[source]

Allows the option to specify a prior and proposal distribution for the hyper-parameters, \(\mathbf{\psi}_k\) for each of the \(R\) latent Gaussian forces

time_input_setup(data_times, aug_times=None, nspace=1)[source]¶

Handles the specification of the ‘data_times’ for which fitting will occur as well as an augmented time set ‘aug_times’ for prediction and complete data modelling

data_times : double array_like
An array with shape (n_data, ) with the input times at which observations were made
aug_times : double array_like or string, optional (default: None)
Either an array of additional latent variables at which model fitting is to be carried out. Or else a string specifying a method to automatically generate additional latent inputs
x_gibbs_update()[source]¶

updates the latent trajectory using gibbs sampling from the Gaussian posterior

x_gp_setup(kern_type='sqexp', x_kernels=None)[source]

Handles the initalisation of the latent Gaussian Processes. This involves constructing the GradientKernel

Note

While this initalises a list of GradientGaussianProcess objects they are essentially just containers for the GradientKernel because of the additional \(\gamma\) parameters. Once the Kernel is updated to include a ‘nugget’ variable this will be updated.

x_gps_kpar_init(kpar=None)[source]¶

Initalise the values of the latent GP hyperparameters

x_mod_cond_logpdf(x, g, gammas, phi)[source]¶

The log of the conditional pdf of the ‘model’
